Album of the Campaign of 1861 in Western Virginia
War scenes
mdRecord.dcterms:creator: Roesler, J. Nep.
mdRecord.dcterms:description: Picket on New River, Camp Anderson, W.V. -- Picket on Lover's Leap (Road to the Log House), Camp Anderson -- Fall near the Log House, Camp Anderson -- Pickets in the woods after the engagement, near the Drill Ground, C Andrsn -- Advance in the woods, C Andrsn -- Skirmishing, New River -- Log House on Miller's Ferry, Camp Anderson -- Crossing to Fayetteville -- Hawk's Nest, 800 feet high, on New River W.V. -- View from Hawk's Nest, towards the East -- View from Hawk's Nest, towards the West -- Pickets on the road fr Cp Andrsn to Tompkin's Farm -- Tompkin's Farm (Camp Gauley Mount.) -- Fall on the road between Tompkin's Farm and Gauley Bridge W.V. -- Camp, Gauley Bridge -- View near Gauley Ferry -- March to the landing -- Crossing Little Birch River to Bulltown -- Thunder-storm (Big Sewell Mountain) (Reconnoissance) -- Battle at Carnifax Ferry.
In bound volume, without collective title. Title supplied by cataloger; statement of responsibility and imprint information appear on each lithograph.
Sometimes found with title: Album of the Campaign of 1861 in Western Virginia.

Lithographs described in "America on stone" (p. 170) as "War scenes sketched and drawn on stone by J. Nep Roester [sic]." Two of the lithographs are listed by name, along with "five small views of Camp Anderson." Peters concludes "many other interesting war prints were produced by these combinations."
SPECIAL COLLECTIONS: Bound in purple cloth, with black cloth backstrip. Paul Mellon bequest, May 12, 2000.
